result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cornell S Preston

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 14, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

10:22 AM Defendant Cornell S Preston in court, in custody.  Attorney Charles D Collier in court for Cornell S Preston.  Attorney Lexi Keyes in court for State of Wisconsin.  Still waiting on discovery in some of the cases. Court will set for another STC.
Status conference scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

9:30 AM Defendant Cornell S Preston in court.  Attorney Charles D Collier in court for Cornell S Preston.  Prosecuting attorney Lexi Keyes in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Court called Dr. Schoenecker to confirm that DE reached out to Dr.    Set up appt for next week.  Court will set for a new competency hearing. 

Atty Collier not sure competency eval is necessary, has had conversations and believes he understands and can assist in defense.   DE believes he is competent.  State takes no position.  CT vacates order for competency evaluation.
Status conference scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Competency hearing scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 01:20 pm.

2:04 PM  Defendant is in DCJ.  Case rescheduled to go with new charges pending tomorrow.

for competency exam
Competency hearing on August 22, 2022 at 01:20 pm.

- Defendant shall not consume alcohol. 
Trial Judge - Br 13

02:47 PM Defendant in court, in custody via Zoom with Attorney Jacob A Idlas.  Benjamin Wagner appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant declined to meaningfully participate in proceedings. Brief adjournment to allow PD Idlas to consult privately with defendant. 02:54 PM Defense requested to proceed with hearing without defendant. Defense received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  The Court has reviewed the Complaint, makes a finding of probable cause and  ORDERS A COMPETENCY EVALUATION  pursuant to Wis. Stats. 971.14.  The Dept of Health & Family Services shall examine the defendant's mental competency to proceed.  Competency hearing scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 01:20 pm.
PSA Report
